description: Western leaders, including Joe Biden, Emmanuel Macron, and others, accused the Russian authorities of being responsible for Alexei Navalny's death in the colony. Putin's press secretary, Dmitry Peskov, deemed these statements 'absolutely unacceptable' and 'boorish'.
original:
Putin’s press secretary called “absolutely unacceptable” statements by Western “statesmen” about the responsibility of the Russian President for the death of Navalny. “These statements certainly cannot cause any damage to the head of our state, but they absolutely do not paint those who make such statements.” . In conditions when there is no information, we consider it absolutely impermissible to make such, well, let’s say, frankly boorish statements; it does not befit government officials from whose mouths we heard such statements,” Interfax quotes Dmitry Peskov.

The fact that it was the Russian authorities who were responsible for the death of Alexei Navalny in the colony was stated, in particular, by Joe Biden, Emmanuel Macron, the head of Lithuania Gitanas Nausėda, the President of Latvia Edgar Rinkevich, the President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky and the former President of Georgia Mikheil Saakashvili.

description: Russian Armed Forces expanded their success by 500 meters in depth overnight, encountering organized enemy strongholds. The Ukrainian Armed Forces are struggling to provide ammunition and fire reinforcement to their defensive units, while also facing difficulties in evacuating. Russian scouts maintain control of the approaches, day and night.
original:
Breakthrough, cauldron attempts and assault on Rabotino. Over the past night, units of the Russian Armed Forces expanded their success to another 500 meters in depth.

At the present moment we are encountering difficulties with the first well-organized enemy strongholds. But the enemy still has problems with providing ammunition and fire reinforcement for units in defense.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are trying with all their might to keep our people out of the eastern outskirts of Rabotino.

The opponent also has difficulty evacuating. Our scouts control the approaches both day and night, something the enemy cannot boast of.

Prisoners note a large number of SOCH.Arkhangel Spetsnaz. Subscribe.

description: An investigation into the circumstances of Alexei Navalny's death is underway, with all necessary actions being taken. However, the results of the investigation have not been made public yet.
original: Peskov: an investigation into the circumstances of the death of Alexei Navalny is underway “All necessary actions in this regard are being carried out. But so far the results of this investigation have not been made public and, in fact, they are unknown,” said the presidential press secretary. Other statements by Peskov: Statements by Western politicians on the topic of Navalny’s death are boorish, they are not befitting statesmen and do not decorate them. The issue of transferring Alexei’s body Navalny's relatives do not belong to the KremlinThe positions of Russia and Armenia on Ukraine diverge diametrically, the Russian Federation will continue to persistently explain that it is right

event: Meeting of Standing Committee on Budget, Tax Policy and Finance
description: A meeting of the standing committee on budget, tax policy and finance of the Gorlovka City Council of the Donetsk People's Republic was held on February 19, 2024, under the leadership of Alexander Kunov. The meeting was attended by deputy chairmen, representatives of the prosecutor's office, and employees of structural divisions of the city administration.
original:
Roman Konev: A meeting of the standing committee on budget, tax policy and finance of the Gorlovka City Council of the Donetsk People's Republic of the first convocation was held

On February 19, 2024, a meeting of the standing committee on budget, tax policy and finance of the Gorlovka City Council of the Donetsk People's Republic of the first convocation was held under the leadership of the chairman of the committee, Alexander Kunov.

The meeting was attended by deputy chairmen of the Gorlovka City Council, representatives of the prosecutor's office of the city of Gorlovka and employees of structural divisions of the administration of the city of Gorlovka.

At the meeting, deputies reviewed regulatory legal acts for their further adoption at a meeting of the Gorlovka City Council.#Gorlovkacity council@roman_konev79

description: Ukraine is set to receive up to 100 units of automated demining equipment this year, which will aid in the demining of agricultural lands in de-occupied territories. The process is complex and costly, requiring significant financial resources and personnel. International funds have joined the financing of humanitarian demining efforts, with over 1,000 pyrotechnicians working in the Kherson region alone.
original:
❗️This year, Ukraine should receive up to 100 units of automated demining equipment, said Dmytro Solomchuk, a member of the Committee on Agrarian and Land Policy. Demining agricultural land is a complex and lengthy procedure that requires huge financial costs. We can already say that about 35-40 billion dollars need to be spent on demining in Ukraine, as well as a lot of people, equipment and resources. One of the most important tasks in Ukraine today remains the demining of agricultural lands in the de-occupied territories. Up to 100 units of automated demining equipment from various funds should arrive in Ukraine this year. This should speed up the demining process and ensure the safety of pyrotechnicians, the politician said.

According to him, many international funds have now joined the financing of humanitarian demining. As a result, more than 1,000 pyrotechnicians work within the Kherson region alone. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site/Instagram/ Twitter

event: Ukrainian Refugees in the UK at Risk of Homelessness
description: Thousands of Ukrainian refugees in the UK are at risk of becoming homeless due to inadequate funding mechanisms. Despite an 18-month extension of their visas, local councils face pressure to accommodate refugees who require aid or want to move away from host families. Many Ukrainian families struggle to rent housing due to shortages and high advance payments.
original:
Forwarded from: InoTV
Thousands of Ukrainian refugees in the UK are at risk of becoming homeless - The Guardian In the UK there are calls for an urgent review of funding mechanisms for Ukrainian refugees amid concerns that 9 thousand Ukrainians have applied for homelessness assistance, writes The Guardian.
 
On Sunday, the government announced an 18-month extension of Ukrainians' three-year visas, which were due to expire in March 2025. Local councils welcomed the move but warned they still face enormous pressure to accommodate refugees who apply for aid or who want to move away from the British families whose homes they have been living in since the conflict began. Compared to last year, the number of Ukrainians who are now in temporary accommodation has increased by 25%.
 
Many Ukrainian families simply cannot rent housing on their own, since in some areas there is already a shortage of housing, and in others, landlords require large advance payments and guarantees. InoTV. Subscribe

He emphasized the importance of defending the country, its people, and integral territories that have been part of the state for centuries. He assured that everything will be done to restore order and achieve complete success in the special military operation, culminating in a victory.

We defend our country, our people, territories that are an integral part of our state, which have been part of our state for centuries and which they tried to take away from us. We will do everything to ensure that order is restored and the special military operation ends in complete success. That is, a victory.

event: Increase in Demand for Mental Disorder Treatment Drugs
description: In Russia, there has been a significant surge in demand for drugs treating mental disorders. Sales of antidepressants have risen by 43% and antipsychotics by 35% compared to the same period in 2021.
original: In Russia, demand for drugs for the treatment of mental disorders has increased. Over the past month, sales of antidepressants have increased by 43%, and antipsychotics by 35% compared to the same period in 2021.

event: Montenegro Offers Military Cooperation to Serbia
description: Montenegro, a NATO member, has expressed readiness for regional military cooperation with Serbia, respecting its military neutrality. The cooperation would focus on areas such as military medicine, chemical and biological protection, and others.
original: Montenegro is ready for military cooperation with Serbia: “A country that is friendly to us”🇲🇪🇷🇸🪖Montenegro, as a NATO member, respects the military neutrality of Serbia and is ready for regional cooperation with this country, said the Minister of Defense of Montenegro Dragan Krapović, emphasizing that in this area from Podgorica there is “absolute readiness”, since the development of good neighborly relations is one of the priorities. “This is primarily military medicine, chemical and biological protection, and other areas. All doors are open for Serbia, and [on our part] there is absolute readiness,” said the politician.@balkanist

description: Andriy Zadorozhny, Chairman of the Committee on Human Rights, met with representatives of the Platform of Humanitarian Non-Governmental Organizations to discuss issues related to collaborative activities in temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine and the introduction of responsibility at the legislative level.
original:
❗️Chairman of the Committee on Human Rights Andriy Zadorozhny met with representatives of the Platform of Humanitarian Non-Governmental Organizations. At the meeting, they discussed problematic issues related to the introduction of responsibility for collaborative activities at the legislative level, in particular in the context of the possibility of international humanitarian organizations carrying out their activities in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine.

Joanna Harbalinska, Director of the Platform of Humanitarian Non-Governmental Organizations, drew attention to the problems that arise when issuing permits for foreigners to enter Ukraine and possible ways to solve them through certain legislative developments.

Expressing his gratitude for the work carried out within the framework of the Platform, Andriy Zadorozhny emphasized the Committee's openness to effective cooperation on the development of legislative initiatives. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site/ Instagram/ Twitter

description: A round table discussion, 'Multinational Russia. We preserve our languages', was held as part of the exhibition-forum 'Russia' to celebrate International Mother Language Day. Participants discussed the development and preservation of native languages in Russia, the role of indigenous communities, and best practices for language preservation.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Delegation to UNESCO
📆The exhibition-forum “Russia” hosted a series of events dedicated to the International Mother Language Day, which is celebrated annually on February 21.

One of the events was the round table “Multinational Russia. We preserve our languages.”❗️Participants of the round table discussed the prospects and challenges for the development of native languages of Russia, the contribution and role of indigenous communities in matters of preserving native languages, the best practices of the work of indigenous peoples of Russia in preserving the languages of minority peoples, as well as the progress in implementing the Action Plan for in 2022-2032 International Decade of Indigenous Languages in🇷🇺.💬“The native language is a basic component, the basis of the culture of any people. The topic of preserving the languages of indigenous peoples concerns not only the peoples themselves. It is important for us to unite the efforts of all parties - the state, science, business and the indigenous peoples themselves. <..> We are a multinational Russia. We preserve our languages."

description: The FSB of Russia detained two residents of Novoaidar in the LPR for espionage, who had been transferring data about Russian servicemen to the SBU since 2022. The spies collected and transmitted information on military equipment and personnel locations and routes, aiding the Ukrainian armed forces.
original:
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦The FSB of Russia in the LPR detained two residents of the village of Novoaidar for espionage and transferring data about Russian servicemen to the SBU. Two residents of Novoaidar began to cooperate with representatives of the SBU in order to assist the Ukrainian armed forces. Since the beginning of 2022, they have been collecting and transmitting data on the locations and routes of movement of military equipment and personnel of the Russian Armed Forces involved in a special military operation. They transmitted the received data to an employee of the Ukrainian special service via Internet messengers.

A criminal case has been initiated on the grounds of a crime under Article 276 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Espionage”. description: Ansar Allah (Houthis) forces attacked the cargo ship Rubymar in the Bab al-Mandeb Strait, causing a large fire and forcing the crew to abandon ship. The ship, sailing from the UAE to Bulgaria, was hit by an anti-ship ballistic missile. It was operated by Lebanese company GMZ SHIP MANAGEMENT CO SA and had armed guards on board.
original:
The armed forces of the Yemeni government Ansar Allah (Houthis) knocked down the cargo ship Rubymar in the Bab al-Mandeb Strait, which was sailing from the UAE to Bulgaria. It is reported that after a hit or near explosion by an anti-ship ballistic missile, a large fire broke out on the ship and, according to UKMTO, the crew abandoned it. The bulk carrier itself sailed under the flag of Belize, owned by the British company GOLDEN ADVENTURE SHIPPING SA, and the operator is Lebanese
GMZ SHIP MANAGEMENT CO SA. The ship reported having armed guards on board.

event: Shortage of Medical Personnel in Crimea
description: Crimea's hospitals are facing a shortage of medical personnel with specialized skills, particularly anesthesiologists-resuscitators, endocrinologists, psychiatrists, and oncologists. Despite being 90% staffed with middle and junior staff, the peninsula's medical institutions require these specialized professionals.
original:
The Ministry of Health of Crimea told what specialized specialists are missing in hospitals. Hospitals are 90% staffed with middle and junior staff, but there is a shortage of medical personnel with narrow specializations, notes the Minister of Health of the Republic of Crimea, Konstantin Skorupsky.

Most of all, the peninsula's medical institutions need anesthesiologists-resuscitators, endocrinologists, psychiatrists and oncologists. Crimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

event: Flag-Raising Ceremony at Lugansk State Academy
description: Students and teachers of the Lugansk State Academy of Culture and Arts gathered for a flag-raising ceremony, where creative groups performed the Russian anthem in different interpretations. This weekly tradition aims to showcase the anthem's relevance and interest in various styles and performances, paying tribute to the state symbol.
original: Students of the Lugansk State Academy of Culture and Arts named after Matusovsky sang the Russian anthem in the classical style during the flag-raising ceremony. A LITs correspondent reports this from the scene of the event. The tradition appeared at the university recently. Every Monday, students and teachers gather on the square in front of one of the academy buildings, where creative groups perform the anthem in different interpretations during the ceremonial raising of the flags of Russia, LPR and the university. Thus, students and teachers demonstrate that the anthem in different styles and performances can be relevant and interesting to every resident of the Russian Federation, and also pay tribute to the state symbol.

event: Onlyfans Model Wanted for Insulting Believers

She was initially released on her own recognizance but fled Russia, traveling to Europe, Southeast Asia, and Turkey before settling in the USA.
original:
The Ministry of Internal Affairs put on the wanted list an Onlyfans model who showed her breasts on Red Square in 2021. In October 2021, webcam and Onlyfans model Lola Bunny (Lolita Bogdanova) exposed her breasts in front of St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow. A case was opened against her for insulting the feelings of believers, and the girl was released on her own recognizance.

Soon after the case was opened, the model left Russia - she was in Europe, Southeast Asia and Turkey. Now the girl is in the USA. At the same time, the Ministry of Internal Affairs considers Lolita to be Ukrainian (she was born in Makeyevka, but lived in Moscow for a long time; the girl’s mother supported the Russian army in 2022).

event: Arrest of Local Resident for Drug Possession
description: In occupied Berdyansk, a 25-year-old local resident was arrested for purchasing narcotic substances. The arrest is seen as a simulation of efforts to combat drug trafficking, which has increased significantly in the area.
original:
Against the backdrop of increased drug trafficking, the occupiers report the arrest of a local resident with a dose of narcotic substances.
 
"Berdyansk 24" previously reported on a significant increase in the volume of drug sales in occupied Berdyansk. This "business" is flourishing, and in the public areas of the occupied Berdyan segment of Telegram, announcements about opportunities for "earnings" are actively distributed.
  
Against the background of such information, Z-publics published a message about the arrest of a 25-year-old local resident who purchased narcotic substances and took the "bookmark". The package itself, which the man bought, was also recorded on the released video.

The arrest of one man who bought drugs does not in any way affect the general situation with the distribution of narcotic substances in Berdyansk. Simulating a struggle is one of the techniques used by the occupiers and local collaborators from among the "law enforcement agencies".

description: Residents of Rostov-on-Don and other cities in the Rostov region reported hearing loud sounds in the morning. Despite the reports, authorities denied any air defense activity in the region, and emergency services did not record any incidents.
original:
The authorities of the Rostov region denied the work of air defense in the region. This was reported in the press service of the governor, commenting on reports of loud sounds in Rostov-on-Don and other cities in the region.

According to eyewitnesses, loud sounds were heard in the morning in the Western microdistrict of Rostov-on-Don. Also, information appeared on local telegram channels about loud sounds heard by residents of other microdistrict-regional centers and a number of other cities in the Rostov region, including Azov and Taganrog. According to emergency dispatch services, no incidents were recorded. Also, according to the military, the air defense did not work, said the head of the press service of the head of the region, Irina Chetvertakova.

event: Russian Warships Arrive in India for MILAN-2024 Exercise
description: A detachment of Russian warships, including the Guards Missile Order of Nakhimov cruiser 'Varya' and the frigate 'Marshal Shaposhnikov', has arrived in India to participate in the international multilateral naval exercise 'MILAN-2024'. The Varyag crew will engage in the exercises, while Marshal Shaposhnikov will replenish supplies and continue long-distance missions.
original:
Ships of the Pacific Fleet of the Russian Navy have arrived in India, the Russian Ministry of Defense reports.

A detachment of warships - the Guards Missile Order of Nakhimov cruiser "Varya" and the frigate "Marshal Shaposhnikov" will take part in the international multilateral naval exercise "MILAN-2024".

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the Belgorod Region, along with the regional Investigative Directorate, dismantled a criminal group operating in the Gubkinsky and Starooskolsky urban districts. event: Flight Tests of Vertical Take-off UAS
description: Sukhoi Design Bureau conducted successful flight tests of a prototype vertical take-off UAS, testing control algorithms and operation of takeoff, hovering, and landing systems. The new civilian drone, designed for off-airfield-based unmanned transport, combines the advantages of an airplane and a helicopter, with a hybrid propulsion system and vertical takeoff and landing capabilities.
original:
Forwarded from: PJSC "UAC"
Sukhoi Design Bureau conducted flight tests of a prototype vertical take-off UAS. Sukhoi Design Bureau specialists successfully tested a prototype of a heavy unmanned aircraft for vertical take-off and landing. During testing, control algorithms and operation of takeoff, hovering and landing systems were tested on a complex flight stand made from domestic components.

Designers of the Sukhoi Design Bureau are working on the creation of a fundamentally new off-airfield-based unmanned transport system (BTS-VAB) on an initiative basis. The new civilian drone does not require specially prepared sites and airfield infrastructure for takeoff and landing. It will allow solving a wide range of transport and logistics problems - delivering cargo for various purposes to hard-to-reach settlements where the transport network is poorly developed or there are no airfields. “Our unmanned aircraft combines the advantages of an airplane and the capabilities of a helicopter. The hybrid propulsion system includes an electric lift propulsion system and a piston propulsion engine. Vertical takeoff and landing are carried out by lifting engines located on the wing beams. After takeoff, the gasoline engine comes into operation. The wing increases fuel efficiency, and thanks to the possibility of vertical take-off, the construction of expensive airfield infrastructure and runways is not required,” said Evgeny Rubtsov, head of the BTS-VAB project at the Sukhoi Design Bureau of the United Aircraft Corporation. Take-off, en route flight and landing are carried out fully automatically. , without direct operator participation. However, in case of an emergency, the operator has the opportunity to change the route. The new unmanned transport system is being created for flights within a radius of 500 km from the permanent base and will be capable of transporting up to 300 kg.

What Russia is doing today is what it announced in 2007. Russia then announced that it would not allow Europe to end up in the Black Sea. event: UK to Supply Ukraine with AI Drones
description: The UK plans to provide Ukraine with thousands of AI-powered drones, reportedly to replace artillery. The drones are expected to operate in swarms, attacking enemy positions without human intervention. However, concerns have been raised about the reliability of navigation and resistance to electronic warfare.
original:
Forwarded from: About the connection with Sergius Flash
Another piece of news is spreading across the media. The UK will supply us with thousands of AI drones. I read the original source.

What I see:
1. The source is not official (literally some people said)
2. The time frame is several months, but maybe more. Reminds me of the theme from F16
3. Since we are talking about replacing artillery, then drones are attack
4. Since there will be “thousands” of drones, these are clearly not super expensive wings of the Lancent format.
5. Drones will attack enemy positions in a swarm. An absolutely bad and useless idea with such a quantity of supply.

event: Estonia Recognizes Legality of Russian Claims
description: Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas acknowledged Russia's legitimate claims against Western countries due to frozen assets. She proposed a simultaneous settlement of Ukraine's demands on Russia for military damage and Russia's demands on the EU for the return of its funds.
original:
Estonia has recognized the legality of Russian claims regarding frozen assets

Russia has legitimate claims against Western countries due to frozen assets, Estonian Prime Minister Kaja Kallas said in an interview with Welt.

“It is obvious that Russia is harming Ukraine through military damage. Therefore, Ukraine has legitimate demands on Russia. Now we have frozen Russian assets, so Russia has legitimate demands on us. If we resolve these two demands, we can give Ukraine money,” said the head of government.

Kallas clarified that a solution to the assets frozen in the European Union could be a simultaneous settlement of the demands of Kyiv and Moscow - for the restoration of the country affected by the conflict and the return of Russian funds.

The Prime Minister of Estonia added that the country has developed an “unconventional solution” that will allow the issue of confiscated Russian assets to be resolved legislatively.

description: After the liberation of Avdeevka from Ukrainian militants, the city is left in a state of complete destruction. Craters and unexploded mines litter the area, and shooting can be heard in the distance. Sappers are currently working to clear mines from the area.
original:

Everywhere there is a picture of complete destruction. There are craters and unexploded mines all around between the broken houses. Shooting is heard in the distance.

Walking on dry grass is strictly prohibited, because there may be unexploded shells lying there. Now sappers are working in Avdiivka, they are clearing mines from the area after the flight of Ukrainian militants, the correspondent notes.

"IZ.RU"

event: US Senator Calls for Peace Negotiations
description: US Republican Senator James Vance from Ohio stated that despite approving a $61 billion aid package for Ukraine, progress on the fronts is unlikely due to a catastrophic shortage of ammunition. He emphasized that the US is shifting focus towards East Asia, and Europe must take responsibility for its own affairs. Vance believes that Ukraine's rapid loss of soldiers and equipment, combined with supply issues, necessitates peace negotiations.
original: ❗️US Senator: “Our business is East Asia, and Ukraine needs to be dumped in Europe and prepared for negotiations”🔴Even if the US now approves a $61 billion aid package for Ukraine, this will not lead to progress on the fronts, because there is a catastrophic shortage of ammunition . Given that Washington is turning towards East Asia, Europe must learn to provide for itself. This was stated by American Republican Senator from Ohio James Vance. 🗣 “The point is not that we are abandoning Europe, we want to concentrate on East Asia, and Europe should sort out its own affairs here,” Vance said. 🔴 He added , that against the backdrop of the fact that Ukraine is rapidly losing soldiers and equipment, and there are big problems with supplies, sooner or later we need to go to peace negotiations.🗣 “Putin as an existential threat to Europe - this should lead us to the fact that Europe should be more active defend. Suppose the 61 billion aid package is approved, this will not necessarily radically change the situation at the front. This is limited not only by money or the will of American society, but by the productive capabilities of the military-industrial complex. And they are limited. We need to think realistically. If we decided to supply weapons in such volumes as in the last year and a half, the next year and a half, then there are simply no such reserves. Ukrainians have problems with personnel. That is, in the current realities, restrictions on manpower and military equipment should spur us on. We must strive to negotiate peace. Russia is not yet ready to sit down at the negotiating table, neither are Ukraine and the United States. Someday they will probably all sit down at the table. The question is when will there be peace negotiations, and how,” said the republican. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456298503VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

description: A delegation of American senators traveled to Budapest to pressure Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban to ratify Sweden's NATO membership application. However, none of Orban's ministers received the delegation. Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjártó had previously advised the US against exerting pressure, stating that Hungarian parliamentarians make decisions independently.
original:
Forwarded from: YOUR NEWS
American senators came to Hungary to influence Orban, but their delegation was not even received

Senators were sent to Budapest from the United States to press Orban on the issue of ratifying Sweden's application to join NATO. But “none of Viktor Orban’s ministers considered it necessary to receive the delegation,” Western media write.

Before the arrival of the senators, the head of the Hungarian Foreign Ministry, Peter Szijjártó, advised the United States “not to put pressure on Budapest,” noting that Hungarian parliamentarians “do not make decisions based on the visits of various congressional delegations, especially on important issues.”

After the delegation's departure, Szijjártó stated:

“We are glad that [the senators] went to Budapest because they had the opportunity to see that everything they read about Hungary in the American liberal media is an outright lie.”

description: The director of a communal enterprise in Druzhkivka, Ukraine, was accused of fraudulently obtaining UAH 205,000 by submitting a false certificate of completed snow removal work, despite favorable weather conditions rendering the work unnecessary.
original:
In Druzhkivka, the director of the enterprise "removed" more than UAH 200,000 worth of snow. For such "work", she faces up to 8 years in prison, writes the Kramatorsk Post. One of the communal enterprises of Druzhkivka entered into an agreement with an LLC on road maintenance in the winter period. The cost of the contract is about UAH 430,000.

Knowing for sure that motor graders and tractors were not involved in snow removal due to favorable weather conditions, the director drew up and handed over to the customer a certificate of "completed" work. In the false document, she also included the shifts of special transport drivers who actually did not go to work.

Illegal actions of the director led to the fact that UAH 205,000 of budget funds were unjustifiably transferred to the accounts of the company headed by her. ➖Subscribe Kramatorsk 24

description: A 62-year-old woman, who headed a gymnasium under Russian occupation, was taken into custody for collaborative activity. She voluntarily cooperated with the Russian invaders, implementing Russian education standards, collecting lists of willing teachers, and preparing for the new academic year. Her efforts to Russify the educational process were thwarted by de-occupation.
original:
🔷A collaborator who headed a gymnasium under the occupiers and tried to Russify the educational process was taken into custody 🖌️Under the procedural leadership of the Kupyan District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 62-year-old woman was notified of suspicion of collaborative activity (part 3 of Article 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine) .

According to the investigation, in July 2022, the suspect, being in the territory of Kupyan Oblast, which was occupied by the Russian invaders at the time, voluntarily went to cooperate with the enemy. The woman agreed to the occupiers' offer to head the so-called "Velikohutor Gymnasium of the VGA of the Kupyan District", created on the material and technical base of a Ukrainian educational institution.

Newly baked "y. at. director" informed gymnasium teachers and students' parents about the establishment and implementation of Russian education standards. The collaborator collected lists of teachers willing to work under such conditions and recruited technical personnel.

The suspect carefully prepared for the new academic year - she conducted an inventory of property, received from a representative of the occupation authorities sample documents in accordance with the standards of the Russian Federation, including certificates of secondary education.

In order to finally Russify the educational process, the "director" made a description of Ukrainian textbooks and books for their subsequent removal as "Nazi" literature.

While preparing the premises of the gymnasium for the new academic year, the collaborator drew up a "list of office supplies for first-graders" and a "list of students" under her personal signature. The suspect managed to organize and hold the First Bell festival, but she failed to finally implement the plans for the Russification of the educational process due to the de-occupation.

Law enforcement officers gathered evidence of the woman's illegal activity and informed her of the suspicion. At the request of the prosecution, she was remanded in custody.

The pre-trial investigation is conducted by department No. 3 of the SV Kupyansk RVP of the GUNP in the Kharkiv region, operational support is provided by the Office of the SBU in the Kharkiv region. ⚔Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office

The decision on the application of the Deputy Prosecutor General was made by the Oktyabrsky District Court of Lipetsk. The court banned the activities of Petro Poroshenko, his son Alexey and the general director of the factory Oleg Kazakov in Russia, as it considered it extremist.

description: The winners of the 2023 Presidential Prize of the Russian Federation in the field of science and innovation for young scientists have been announced. Three candidates of science received the award for their groundbreaking research in biology, medicine, artificial intelligence, biosafety, geology, and chemistry. Their work has significant implications for the prevention of neurodegenerative diseases, agriculture, forestry, and geological exploration.
original:
Forwarded from: Political Russia🇷🇺PolitRussia
🇷🇺Young minds are moving Russian science forward. The winners of the Presidential Prize of the Russian Federation in the field of science and innovation for young scientists for 2023 have been announced. This year, three candidates of science received a high award: Susanna Gordleyeva was awarded for her work at the intersection of biology, medicine and artificial intelligence technologies. She discovered a new memory mechanism and built on it a nature-like AI technology. The results obtained are important for the prevention and control of neurodegenerative diseases. Sergey Pavlushin received an award for research related to biosafety. A scientist has found a means of protection against silkworm pests that threaten agriculture and forestry. Olga Yakubovich was awarded for her work on the border between geology and chemistry. Her work in the field of isotope geochemical analysis will make the search for gold and platinum deposits more efficient. These techniques are in demand in geological exploration both in Russia and in a number of African countries.

The Presidential Prize has been awarded since 2008 for significant contributions to the development of domestic science and the development of new technologies in various fields. It goes to the most worthy. Russia, I’m proud!

description: A 37-year-old trainer at the Sprint fitness club in Moscow suffered a seizure while working out on a treadmill, fell off, and hit her head on a weight plate, causing severe head injuries and an epidural hematoma. She is now in intensive care on a ventilator.
original:
A trainer at a Moscow fitness club fell off a treadmill and hit her head on a weight plate after she became ill during a workout. She is now in intensive care on a ventilator.

As SHOT found out, a 37-year-old employee of the Sprint club on Semenovskaya Street felt unwell on Sunday evening: she was working out on a treadmill and had a seizure. After that, the girl flew off the track, hit her head hard on the weight plates, which caused her to suffer a severe head injury and an epidural hematoma.

Fitness club employees called an ambulance for her. The girl has already been operated on and is now in intensive care on a ventilator. The police are investigating the circumstances of the incident. Subscribe to SHOT

50% of Ukrainian women who left for Poland do not want to return. This is evidenced by the results of a survey conducted by the publication Rzeczpospolita.

In total, according to the publication, about 1 million Ukrainians live in Poland, most of whom are women.

Other results of the survey:🇺🇦The average age of Ukrainian women is 44 years old, 83% have higher education, 53% came with children.🇺🇦50% of women are employed: 63% work in Poland, 23% work remotely in Ukraine, 8% in others countries; only 30% work in their specialty. 45% know Polish, 20% understand Polish, but do not speak it. 47% of children attend Polish schools, 8% study online only in Ukrainian schools, 27% study in In Poland and Ukraine, 18% do not study anywhere

description: Czech farmers are protesting against the EU's 'green' agenda, which is harming their farms, and demanding help from the government regarding increased energy tariffs due to the refusal of Russian fuel. The protest, involving around 500 tractors, may block key road junctions near Prague.
original:
Czech farmers are driving half a thousand tractors to Prague to express their protest against the EU’s “green” agenda. The protesters not only want to convey their opinion about the “green” initiatives of Brussels that are ruining farms, but also demand help from the country’s authorities in connection with the increase in energy tariffs due to refusal of Russian fuel.

The organizers of the action said that agricultural machinery could block key road junctions near the Czech capital. It is unknown how long the protest will last.

The Czech Republic has joined a large group of countries where farmers are on strike due to ruinous working conditions, as well as unequal competition provoked by preferences for Ukrainian food suppliers. Farmers in France, Belgium, Spain, Germany, the Netherlands and, of course, Poland are already expressing their dissatisfaction, where, despite the ban on the import of Ukrainian grain, it still ends up.

The country's Prime Minister Petr Fiala called farmers protesting in Prague against Brussels' agricultural policy supporters of Russia.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Armed Forces Cup in Arm Wrestling
description: The Russian Navy's Captain 3rd Rank Oleg Balkovoy won the championship title in the absolute weight category at the Armed Forces Cup in arm wrestling, held in St. Petersburg. The Navy team took second place in the team competition, behind the Southern Military District.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Navy🇷🇺|ZOV|🇷🇺Navy Of Russia
A representative of the Navy became the champion of the Russian Armed Forces Cup in arm wrestling in the absolute weight category.

In St. Petersburg, on the basis of the Military Institute of Physical Culture, the Armed Forces Cup in arm wrestling was held, dedicated to the memory of a graduate of the university - holder of the Order of Kutuzov, Captain M.A. Sorochenko. 14 teams took part in the competition, with a total of more than 90 military athletes.

The tournament received the status of a master's - the winners in their weight categories receive the title "Master of Sports", and the participants in the semi-finals deserve the sports category - "Candidate for Master of Sports".

According to the results of the team competition, the Navy team took second place, behind the athletes of the Southern Military District. The VKS team closed the top three.

In the individual competition in the absolute weight category, Master of Sports Captain 3rd Rank Oleg Balkovoy became the champion; Captain-Lieutenant Alexander Khlystunov won the silver medal in the weight category up to 110 kg, and Major Vitaly Kovalenko won the bronze medal in the weight category up to 100 kg.

DIiMK Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation#armwrestling#sports#competitions

event: Strike on Lviv Center of Space Research Institute
description: A strike was carried out on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine. The center is involved in the development and manufacturing of sensors, instruments, and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.
original:
We report on Lvov: strike for February 15th. Lviv patriots reported that the strike was on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine. The center is one of the developers and manufacturers of sensors, instruments and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.

Main directions of scientific and production activities:

1. Electromagnetic research in a conducting medium (cosmic plasma, soil and sea water), creation of instruments for solving geophysical problems of measuring the parameters of electric and magnetic fields in a wide range of frequencies.
2. Study of acoustic-electromagnetic interactions in the atmosphere and ionosphere, creation of high-power acoustic emitters.
3. Creation of on-board data collection and processing systems.
4. Development of instruments and systems for measuring, controlling and monitoring technological processes of industrial enterprises.

As proof, a satellite image for February 17, 2024. Revenge of Goodwill

description: The Hispaniola military organization hosted a festive creative evening for returning personnel, those completing rehabilitation, and new recruits. The event featured performances by the Espanyol Jazz Band and Evgeniy, frontman of the Russian Banner group. Awards were presented to distinguished fighters, including numbered knives and brigade license plates.
original:
Forwarded from: Española | Military organization "Hispaniola". OF.
While the combat and military-technical forces of Hispaniola are successfully working in the direction of Chasov Yar and helping to finish things in Avdeevka, for those returning from rotation, for those completing their rehabilitation after injuries, as well as for recruits passing through the KMB, we organized a festive creative evening on the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day , and also presented internal awards to some of Hispaniola’s fighters.

We will soon make important statements about military successes and military forecasts, and about the past event - briefly in the message below and in the video above.

As you can see, they rocked it to the fullest!

Some particularly distinguished fighters received award numbered knives; A number of other comrades who passed the “screening” received brigade license plates. Well, also on this evening, which we called creative for a reason, we all sent another “Easter egg” to the now popular “Word of a Boy”. Much of Espanola's base grew from all of this. But this culture itself is rather amusing to us, both then and now.

However, basic simple street concepts are also very valuable to us. Not only do we not laugh at them, many of them are included in the main principles of Hispaniola. One of them is treating your comrades as truly your own.

The most important part of the last creative evening were the performances of the Espanyol Jazz Band and our old friend Evgeniy, frontman of the Russian Banner group. This was already the second performance for the brigade orchestra, but since then the band has grown both quantitatively and qualitatively.

We will tell you about the musical part of the evening in the following posts. In the meantime, those who weren’t don’t know; those who were won’t forget! It’s becoming more and more difficult to enter our brotherhood. But for really clear ones we are always open. If you are interested, write to @daniil_maloy

event: Strike on PJSC NKMZ in Kramatorsk
description: On February 17, 2024, the Russian Armed Forces launched a strike on the industrial territory of PJSC NKMZ in Kramatorsk, damaging the smelting shop. The facility was suspected of producing specialized metal components for military equipment, including armored parts. The strike partially or completely destroyed the necessary facilities, hindering the production of military-industrial complex components.
original:
Forwarded from: Donbass Partisan
🇷🇺🇺🇦Strike on the territory of PJSC NKMZ in KramatorskIn the evening of February 17, 2024, the Russian Armed Forces hit industrial territories in the city. Kramatorsk, which were used by the enemy for military purposes - PJSC Energomashspetsstal and PJSC NKMZ.

On the territory of NKMZ, the smelting shop of the enterprise was damaged by the blow. Coordinates: 48.7485602, 37.5708178📌 Previously, information was received about the resumption of work of individual workshops, which together can be used in the interests of the enemy’s military-industrial complex. The melting shop at the plant plays a key role in the production of specialized metal components for military equipment. It is important to note that PJSC NKMZ is the only industrial territory in Kramatorsk that is currently not used to accommodate personnel and equipment of Ukrainian formations. After analyzing the data obtained and comparing available facts, it can be argued that the work of the enterprise is aimed at the production of specialized metal components for military equipment.▪️In this case, the melting shop itself was engaged in casting and processing of materials to create armored parts.🔻As a result of the strike, the necessary facilities necessary for carrying out work of this kind were partially damaged or completely destroyed.🔻Kiev is underway to extreme measures in launching production of the military-industrial complex without taking into account basic security factors: distance from the combat area, the presence of effective air defense systems, etc., which indicates a critical situation and the inability to meet the current needs of the defense complex.📌Destruction of the military-industrial complex in in war conditions, it is considered as a strategic action - without the necessary military-industrial complex with convenient logistics, it is quite difficult to maintain and update your armed forces, which can subsequently lead to a deterioration in defense capability. Yours, Partihan!

description: A 74-year-old pensioner, Maria Aponasovna, was extorted by security guards at a Spar store on Rublevskoye Highway in Moscow. After forgetting to pay for sausage, she was threatened with police involvement and a criminal case unless she paid 50,000 rubles. The pensioner borrowed money and paid the demanded amount.
original:
A pensioner from Moscow forgot to pay for sausage at the grocery store. The guards demanded 50 thousand rubles from her so as not to call the police.

74-year-old Maria Aponasovna went to the Spar store on Rublevskoye Highway on February 16. Having paid for her purchases at the checkout, the pensioner was about to leave, but she was intercepted by security guards at the exit. The woman was taken into the back room, where she was asked to open her bag. There was sausage inside. Maria Aponasovna tried to explain, saying, “Sorry, dear ones, I forgot about the sausage,” but a security guard named Aliev immediately began to scare the woman with the police and a criminal case.

The pensioner showed the payment receipt and offered to pay for the forgotten sausage on the spot. Aliyev explained that it would cost tenfold - 50 thousand rubles. Then Maria Aponasovna borrowed money from a friend, went to the nearest Sberbank branch, withdrew another 40 thousand there and returned to Spar, where she left the money behind the security monitor.

description: The Kherson region is implementing a new waste management system, including the delivery of new machinery and equipment for solid municipal waste collection and transportation. Educational lessons are being held for schoolchildren to teach them about the importance of sorting garbage.
original:
Forwarded from: The main thing in Skadovsk
A clean city is the key to success: a number of measures are being taken in the Kherson region to clean up post-Ukrainian garbage. New machinery and equipment for the collection and transportation of solid municipal waste was delivered to the Kherson region. Now in new regions, including ours, a new waste management system is being built. “In Skadovsk there are now separate containers for collecting plastic,” said press secretary of the region’s Ministry of Natural Resources, Ecology and Fisheries Ekaterina Shishatskaya.

What is good and what is bad, as well as why sorting garbage should be taught from an early age, is why educational lessons for schoolchildren are held in the Kherson region. “Children are a very grateful audience, a very responsive listener. For some, this is all new,” shared Galina Sergeevna, a representative of the environmental operator of the Kherson region. At such lessons, children are answered pressing questions, for example, why do we have a bag of bags at home?

Local residents are delighted with these measures, and, as active citizens, they themselves are ready to offer even more ideas to improve the waste collection and disposal process. Previously, we could only dream of such an order. “After Ukraine left, it left behind a very large legacy of garbage,” noted press secretary Ekaterina. And now, together with Russia, we throughout the Kherson region are fighting such a “gift” from the former “authorities”.

event: Investigation into Possible Disclosure of State Secrets
description: The German Prosecutor General's Office is investigating the potential disclosure of state secrets related to the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. A planning permit published online in 2018 contained classified information from the German Ministry of Defense, including details about NATO submarine locations and armament.
original:
The German Prosecutor General's Office will check the possible disclosure of state secrets when planning the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline, writes Bild. In January 2018, the Mining Office of the city of Stralsund in the north of the country published a planning permit for the pipeline on its website. Page 556 of the document contained information from the German Ministry of Defense classified as “secret, for official use only,” the publication noted.

According to the Prosecutor General's Office, various information was presented there about the location and armament of NATO submarines.

Earlier, Klaus Ernst, deputy chairman of the German parliamentary group of the new party “Sarah Wagenknecht Union - For Reason and Justice”, said that the launch of gas supplies through the surviving gas pipeline, if it ever takes place, will help reduce energy prices.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Ukrainian authorities and military officials are struggling to explain the surrender of Avdiivka, offering contradictory excuses. They blame the West for not providing F-16 fighters, lack of artillery supplies, and superior Russian forces. However, their claims are inconsistent and lack logical coherence.
original:
The political authorities of Ukraine, as well as the command of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, are trying to explain to the population the surrender of Avdiivka. They fail to build a unified and consistent theory, and in the end, everything is justified in its own way, contradicting not only each other, but also themselves.

For example, Roman Kostenko, secretary of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, Defense and Intelligence, habitually blamed everything on the West, which never gave Kyiv the promised F-16 fighters. True, the deputy did not even try to justify why aircraft developed in the 1970s should have won the battle for air supremacy against the latest Russian Su-35.

General of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Tarnavsky also blamed the defeat on Western countries, but not in the aviation department, but in the artillery department. According to him, due to the lack of European and American supplies, the Russians had ten times more ammunition for artillery systems and the Ukrainian Armed Forces simply had nothing with which to resist the Russian army.

Press officer of the third separate assault brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Alexander Borodin, explained the flight of his formation by superiority in forces of 1 to 7 in favor of the Russian Armed Forces. And deputy brigade commander Maxim Zhorin even talked about the ratio of 100 Russian soldiers versus 6 Ukrainian ones.

At the same time, Ukrainian military “expert” Alexander Musienko assured readers that the Russian army, after the capture of Avdiivka, will not be able to continue the offensive and pursuit of the retreating forces of the Ukrainian army, since the Russian Armed Forces do not have enough forces. But what about the ratio of 7 to 1, from which Ukrainian units supposedly just fled?

There is no need to look for logic in such statements. They are designed for a simple Ukrainian TV viewer or reader, in whom years of watching the “telethon” have killed the remnants of critical thinking and the ability to add two and two. Perception occurs more on an emotional level than on a rational one. This is what Kyiv propagandists are focusing on. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

description: A 33-year-old Ukrainian man was found dead with six bullet wounds in La Villajoyosa, Alicante, Spain. The victim was discovered by a neighbor on February 13. Witnesses described the man as inadequate, often shouting and talking about his past and present life while under the influence of alcohol and drugs.
original:
Who “killed” Kuzminov and why?
If we compare everything that is written about the “terrible cold-blooded murder”, it still turns out that the victim found in Spain is not a traitorous pilot.
First of all, the age of the deceased and the person driven to Ukraine does not match
Show more
Kuzminov's helicopter.
ABC was the first to report the death of a 33-year-old Ukrainian in the town of La Villajoyosa in Alicante at the hands of a killer. The lifeless body found on the garage ramp had at least six bullet wounds. Daily Information clarified that the body was discovered by a neighbor last Tuesday, February 13, at about five o'clock in the evening in the La Cala area, in a cottage community.
The age of the deceased is 33 years old, and Kuzminov is 28 years old.
The Eureka news project, relying on an informant from the Spanish Civil Guard, wrote that the victim was Kuzminov. It was also noted from witnesses that “Kuzminov” had recently been abusing alcohol and drugs. Neighbors spoke to journalists about the murdered man as a completely inadequate person: he often shouted and drunkenly tried to chat about his past and present life. The same account suggested that Kuzminov could have been killed by Ukrainian special services.
It’s interesting that Eureka news is published only on the X network and runs a telegram channel. Despite 24 thousand subscribers, the post of the Spanish Eureka news account about the death of Kuzminov was read by several people. Now the account on the X network is supposedly no longer available.
Thus, for now the news about the death of the traitorous pilot looks like an outright fake news. In Kyiv, reports of Kuzminov’s death have already been called fake.

event: Protests Against Prime Minister Viktor Orban
description: Demonstrations against Prime Minister Viktor Orban gathered several thousand people in Hungary, sparked by the pardon of a kindergarten director convicted of pedophilia. The opposition criticized the cabinet and Orban, demanding the government's replacement. The protests, nicknamed 'YouTuber', may be influenced by Western propaganda, similar to attempts to organize a Maidan in Serbia.
original:
🔥🇭🇺The situation in Hungary has actively begun to deteriorate: last Friday, demonstrations against Prime Minister Viktor Orban gathered several thousand people.🔻The formal reason for the protests was the pardon by the President of Hungary, Katalin Nowak, in April last year of a kindergarten director convicted of pedophilia. Information about this became known only on February 2 due to the ongoing criminal case, Novak resigned.

At the same time, Orban promptly introduced constitutional amendments to the government that prohibit pardons for crimes against children. But this did not stop the opposition from criticizing the entire cabinet and Orban specifically.

Demonstrators were herded into the square under Hungarian flags and national slogans, including demands to “replace the government of lies and hypocrisy.” Considering that the march was informally nicknamed “YouTuber”, I think you understand where the legs are coming from.

Western propaganda in Serbia followed approximately the same pattern (with adjustments to the details), trying to organize Maidan there. So the Orban government will now be tested for strength - Friday’s provocations are clearly not an isolated incident. #Hungary#protests@pl_syrenka— Poland is not a foreign country

event: Strike on Lviv Center of Space Research Institute
description: A strike was carried out on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine. The center is involved in the development and manufacturing of sensors, instruments, and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.
original:
🫡We are reporting for Lvov: strike for February 15th. Lviv patriots reported that the strike was on the Lviv Center of the Space Research Institute of the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine and the National Space Agency of Ukraine. The center is one of the developers and manufacturers of sensors, instruments and information-measuring systems for space and geophysical research.

Main directions of scientific and production activities:

1. Electromagnetic research in a conducting medium (cosmic plasma, soil and sea water), creation of instruments for solving geophysical problems of measuring the parameters of electric and magnetic fields in a wide range of frequencies.
2. Study of acoustic-electromagnetic interactions in the atmosphere and ionosphere, creation of high-power acoustic emitters.
3. Creation of on-board data collection and processing systems.
4. Development of instruments and systems for measuring, controlling and monitoring technological processes of industrial enterprises.

As proof, a satellite image for February 17, 2024.

"Revenge of Good Will"

description: Regional radio stations 'Autoradio' and 'Europe Plus' received a manual on how to cover Navalny's death, restricting coverage to official statements from the Federal Penitentiary Service, the Investigative Committee, and the Kremlin, as well as 'factual and verified information' from Kremlin-affiliated sources like TASS, RIA Novosti.
original:
Regional radio stations "Autoradio" and "Europe Plus" were sent a manual on how to cover Navalny's death. It says that only statements from the Federal Penitentiary Service, the Investigative Committee and the Kremlin can be given, as well as "factual and verified information" from Kremlin propagandists - TASS, RIA Novosti and " similar sources."

The manual published by Sirena provides two examples of how to correctly cover Navalny’s murder - in the notes he is called a blogger, an extremist and a terrorist.

“We do not escalate or frighten citizens. Without panic and any personal assessment of what is happening, opinions and comments (in this case, Western leaders). No announcements of possible rallies,” said the letter to the regional editors of Europe Plus.

description: The Federal Medical and Biological Agency (FMBA) has opened 9 new industrial medicine centers in Russia, aiming to identify health issues among enterprise employees and take prompt action. This initiative has already shown promising results, with an 18% decrease in overall morbidity rate and a 23% decrease in initial incidence of disability over the past year.
original:
9 new industrial medicine centers of the FMBA (Federal Medical and Biological Agency) have opened in Russia. Their task is to promptly identify health problems among enterprise employees and take action.

14 such centers in the country have already begun their work in 2022. The result was not long in coming - over the past year, the overall morbidity rate decreased by 18%, and the initial incidence of disability decreased by 23%. Currently, 735 of more than two hundred thousand Russian enterprises are under the control of the FMBA, which is over 700 thousand employees.

This is a new level of medicine in Russia. The main reference center is located in the science city of Dubna. Together with the regional centers of the FMBA, they represent a network of digital high-tech health centers, where all the necessary specialists work, from therapists to dentists. These centers accompany the work of individual production facilities and monitor the health of each employee.

In total, by 2027 they plan to open more than 60 industrial medicine centers. Thanks to this, the working-age population will get sick less, the primary incidence of disability should decrease by 10%, and mortality in working age by 20%.@brekotins

description: The SBU and NABU exposed a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery. The Security Service, together with the NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of complex measures, the deputy head of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.

According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.

For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the indicated medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

Law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment", immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal profit.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Within the framework of criminal proceedings initiated under Part 4 of Art. 369 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (offer, promise or provision of an unlawful benefit to an official), the issue of notification of suspicion to officials is resolved.

An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison, with confiscation of property.

Comprehensive measures were conducted under the procedural guidance of the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Prosecutor General's Office.

event: Meeting of Working Group on Youth Voluntary Movement
description: The second meeting of the Working Group on the development of the youth voluntary movement in the CIS member states was held via video link, discussing the implementation of the Action Plan for the Year of the Volunteer Movement in 2024 and upcoming events.
original: ​💥On February 19, the second meeting of the Working Group on the development of the youth voluntary (volunteer) movement in the CIS member states was held via video link.👥It brought together representatives of states and the CIS Executive Committee.🗣️Members of the Working Group exchanged information on the progress of the implementation of the Action Plan for implementation in 2024 Year of the Volunteer Movement in the CIS on the participation of representatives of interested bodies and organizations of the CIS countries in upcoming events. The meeting was chaired by the co-chair of the Working Group, head of the Republican Volunteer Center (Republic of Belarus) Victoria Zakharevskaya. She spoke about the draft Regulations on the basic organization of the CIS member states for scientific and methodological support of the youth volunteer (volunteer) movement. Co-chairman of the Working Group, head of the Center for International Projects of the Association of Volunteer Centers of the Russian Federation Leila Badalova presented the draft Regulations on the basic organization of the CIS member states for development infrastructure and consolidation of volunteer (volunteer) efforts.👉As previously reported, RTU MIREA (the basic organization of the CIS member states for working with youth) organized an International competition for the best emblem of the Year of the Volunteer Movement. At today’s meeting, two proposed options were discussed, one of which will become the emblem of the Year of the Volunteer Movement.🥇It was also discussed that young volunteers of the CIS countries for high achievements in volunteering will be rewarded with gratitude, a diploma from the Council for Youth Affairs of the CIS member states and a badge familiar.

event: Raids on TOT Ahead of Putin's Elections
description: Russian occupiers are conducting house-to-house raids in temporarily occupied territories to legitimize pseudo-elections. The raids aim to capture houses and apartments, collect information, and campaign for participation in the Russian presidential elections. The occupiers are also conducting illegal audio or video recordings of conversations, asking residents about their voting intentions.
original:
The occupiers are conducting a tour of houses on the TOT on the eve of Putin's "elections". The Russians are trying to legitimize pseudo-elections in the temporarily occupied territories.

The main reason for the raids carried out by the occupiers on the TOT in advance of the "elections" were the conclusions drawn from the local fake voting in September 2023. Then the residents of the temporarily occupied territories massively sabotaged the pseudo-elections: they did not open the doors. they ignored visits to precincts, etc. Therefore, the occupiers decided to conduct raids in advance to capture houses and apartments where people live.

Currently, the so-called "members of the election commissions of the Russian Federation" are making rounds of people. They collect information and campaign for participation in the Russian presidential "elections". They conduct illegal audio or video recording of the conversation. During the recording, residents are asked whether they will "vote" or know when the elections are.

The Center of National Resistance notes. that each member of the so-called election commission will bear responsibility for organizing illegal "elections". Moreover, such activity is quite dangerous for health.

description: Navalny's body is undergoing a 'chemical examination' and will not be returned to his relatives for another two weeks. The process typically takes up to five days, but can be prolonged due to various factors, including holidays, weekends, and a high workload of forensic experts.
original:
Navalny’s body will not be given back to his relatives for another two weeks; a “chemical examination” is being carried out on it, the politician’s press secretary said. “If the task is not to hand over the body, the investigator can spend up to a month being sophisticated,” a former employee of the Moscow Region forensic medical examination told Novaya (anonymously) .💬In a normal situation, when no criminal case has been initiated and the body does not require identification, relatives may not be given the body for up to five days.

During this time, the forensic expert opens the body and looks for any bodily injuries, damage to the skin, skull, and all other bones. If there are any injuries or marks on the body, all this is described.

Then the internal organs are described. A piece is taken from each organ - this is called autopsy material. And they do laboratory tests. This takes about another three to five days.

All liquids must be taken for the presence of chemicals: blood, urine, and everything from the stomachs of the brain must be taken for examination. If desired, tests can be done quickly. But after holidays, weekends, in case of incidents with a large number of victims, the bodies can be detained for up to 5 days, i.e. be issued on the 5th day due to the physical workload of forensic experts, and the autopsy results then come even later - from two weeks to a month.

DNA analysis is done if relatives suspect substitution of tests. This is not part of the standard procedure.

The corpse is shown to relatives only when it is taken away by funeral services. And a death certificate is issued within three days - there is a preliminary conclusion about death.

A month is the maximum period for <non-delivery of a body>. This is how long it takes to conduct an examination in the event of a criminal death, the initiation of a criminal case or an investigative investigation.

But usually the body is returned earlier, after taking the necessary tissues - this question remains at the discretion of the investigator. If the task is not to extradite the body, the investigator will use any means necessary to order additional examinations throughout this month. In the photo: Salekhard city morgue / Twitter (X)

description: Military correspondent Andrei Kots was detained by police on Dekabristov Street in Moscow after being found with 2 grams of marijuana. He claimed to have just purchased it, but refused to comment on the incident.
original:
Military correspondent Andrei Kots was detained with marijuana in Moscow.

According to Baza, RIA Novosti journalist and brother Alexander Kots were detained on the night of February 10. Police officers stopped Kots on Dekabristov Street. The journalist was noticeably nervous, so the police decided to search him.

A RIA Novosti employee was found with a package containing an unknown substance; an examination later showed that it was marijuana weighing 2 grams. Kots explained to investigators that he had just bought it and removed the bookmark from the back of the house.

The military correspondent himself is unlikely to face a criminal case (the weight is not the same), however, they are preparing to open a criminal case against the unknown person who sold marijuana to Alexander Kots’ brother under the article on trafficking in narcotic substances.

Kots refused to comment to Baze about his detention. “I don’t understand where you got this information from, I won’t comment,” the journalist said. UPD: After compiling the materials, Andrei Kots was released.

description: The uncontrolled ERS-2 satellite, launched in 1995, is expected to fall to Earth as early as February 21. Due to its unpredictable trajectory, it is unclear where and when the satellite will fall. At an altitude of 200 kilometers, the satellite will begin to burn in the atmosphere at 80 kilometers, with a high probability of some debris falling into the ocean.
original:
Space debris: the uncontrolled ERS-2 satellite, launched in 1995, may fall to Earth as early as February 21, the British television channel Sky News reports.

The most interesting thing about this story is that it is impossible to predict exactly where and when the device (literally) will fall from heaven to Earth. Now the satellite is at an altitude of 200 kilometers. When the device drops to 80 kilometers, it will begin to burn in the layers of the atmosphere.

At the same time, as indicated, there is a high probability that some of the debris will fall into the ocean and will not pose a threat to the population.

ERS-2 was launched in 1995 to observe the Earth. The spacecraft's mission ended in 2011, after which ESA used up its remaining fuel to return from orbit.Subscribe to REN TV

description: A group of five Russian doctors and nine relatives, including children, were evacuated from Gaza to Moscow after being denied evacuation through the Rafah checkpoint on January 18. The Arabic channel and its host Salam Musafer played a crucial role in resolving the issue and facilitating their return.
original:
Forwarded from: Margarita Simonyan
Russian doctors returned to Moscow from Gaza.

A group of five doctors and nine relatives, including children from two to 16 years old, flew from Cairo to Moscow:

1) Abu Zaher Iyad Issa;
2) Alghandur Said Kamal;
3) Al-Ghandour Samir Kamal;
4) Alkhattab Sameh Yusef;
5) Elvan Saber.

It was these compatriots who were denied evacuation through the Rafah checkpoint on January 18, despite the fact that they were on the official lists provided by our diplomats.

The issue of their return to Russia was resolved thanks to the initiative of our Arabic channel and the host Salam Musafer personally. It was he who connected all his connections in Palestine, Russia and beyond to rescue the doctors. And producers Elvira Sukhareva and Maxim Al-Majali were in constant contact with the group and are still with them to this day.

Dr. Iyad Abu Zaher expressed his gratitude to our Arabic channel upon arrival in Cairo:

'Wonderful people, I have to thank them, this esteemed channel and its staff.'

Well done, colleagues!

We now hope that the Ministry of Emergency Situations will help our doctors reunite with their families who were previously evacuated to Ingushetia.

The first photo shows our doctors at the Rafah checkpoint, the second photo shows us at Domodedovo airport.

description: A joint Ukrainian-NATO center for analysis, training, and education will be created in Bydgoszcz, Poland. The center will enable the Armed Forces of Ukraine to train and study with NATO colleagues, focusing on strategy and defense administration. The initiative aims to summarize lessons learned from the war in Ukraine and provide support to Kyiv.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇺🇦🇵🇱About the new Ukrainian-NATO center A joint Ukrainian-NATO center for analysis, training and education will be created in the Polish city of Bydgoszcz. In addition, here the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be able to train and study together with NATO colleagues, and it is also planned to train Ukrainians in strategy and defense administration.

Polish Defense Minister Wladyslaw Kosiniak-Kamysh said that the creation of the center would be “the first initiative of its kind between NATO and Ukraine.”

According to him, this will play an important role in summarizing “the lessons learned from the war in Ukraine” and will provide support to Kyiv. However, any dates or other details about this center are not yet known. Kosiniak-Kamysh only emphasized that everything “depends on the determination of the alliance”: it is logical, the final decision on the creation of the center will most likely be made in July. Currently, a general combat training center for the Joint Armed Forces of NATO is already operating in Bydgoszcz. The new center will likely operate within this structure.

True, it is still unclear whether it will be arranged at all and who will have to pay for it, however, it is likely that in this way the Western partners are planning, for example, to prepare an occupation administration from collaborators.#Poland#NATO#Ukraine@rybartogether with @pl_syrenkaSupport usX (formerly Twitter)Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz (@KosiniakKamysz) on XIncreasing defense capabilities, new means of aid for🇺🇦and the establishment of#NATO-Ukraine Joint Center for Analysis, Training and Education i...

description: At the Munich Security Conference, leaders and defense officials gathered to discuss the world's biggest geopolitical threats. NATO members expressed growing anxiety about Russia's military successes and the potential reduction of US support for the region.
original:
Ukraine's allies envision a world in which the US retreats - BloombergNATO members are now privately speaking of a Russian attack on one of their own as a danger requiring an urgent response, as they increasingly doubt that the US will maintain its traditional role as Europe's protector within the alliance , writes Bloomberg.

Europe's growing anxiety stems from the realization that they find themselves in a situation where Russia has been emboldened by its military successes, the US may be cutting support for its region, and it has done too little to prepare.

That pessimism dominated the conversations this weekend at the Munich Security Conference, where leaders and defense officials are gathering to take stock of the world's biggest geopolitical threats. event: Russian Troops Advance in Orekhovsky Sector

original: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Orekhovsky sector: offensive of the Russian Armed Forces Situation as of 01.00 February 19, 2024🔻Russian troops continue their offensive in the so-called “Rabotinsky ledge.”▪️According to the Archangel of Special Forces, units of paratroopers and motorized riflemen managed to advance 2 km in depth and reach southern and southeastern outskirts of Rabotino.▪️Most likely, the so far confirmed reports of battles on the western outskirts of the village are already a reality. Taking into account the vector of attacks by Russian armored groups and the landing of foot troops to the west of the village, this scenario is quite real.▪️A fair question arises whether the enemy will have time to transfer reinforcements to hold Rabotino. The settlement was severely destroyed during the summer fighting. And if we are objective, there is no way it can become a “fortesy”.📌However, Russian troops will have to “pass right through” the populated area, because it will be difficult, to put it mildly, to gain a foothold in the ruins.High resolution map#MapsDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️* ️⃣➖

description: A visit to Avdeevka revealed the proximity of the city to Donetsk, with locals feeling the impact of every shot and shell. Despite the challenges, Russian residents chose to stay in the city without electricity and water for 2 years, awaiting the opportunity to return home.
original:
Forwarded from: MAKAROV
⚡️Today I visited Avdeevka, looked at the front of humanitarian work before the first volunteer groups went to the city.

What struck me was how close she was always. Just a little time on the road - and you are already there. This is literally a city that is part of Donetsk. The tenth district, which was once taken away from us.

The locals also feel this closeness. They heard every shot in Donetsk, every shell flying in our direction. For them, our pain is not alien at all.

That is why I met Russian people in the city who chose to live for 2 years without electricity and water, in the midst of hostilities, just to return home. I'm glad it worked out for them.
