description: Police in the Golopristansky district discovered 500g of cannabis with a characteristic smell of marijuana in the home of a 45-year-old resident of Chulakovka village. The owner claimed it was for personal use, but the substance was sent for research and a criminal case may be initiated under Article 228 of the Russian Criminal Code.
location: Chulakovka, Golopristansky District, Kherson Oblast, Ukraine
original:
In the Golopristansky district, police found cannabis with the characteristic smell of marijuana in the home of a local resident. Police officers, while following up information received about the possible storage of narcotic drugs, inspected the home of a 45-year-old resident of the village of Chulakovka, Golopristansky district.
 
In the attic of the house, law enforcement officers found and seized a polymer bag with a crushed gray-green plant substance with a characteristic smell of marijuana, weighing about 500 g.
 
The owner of the house explained that he picked hemp, dried it, crushed it and stored it for personal use without the purpose of sale.
 
The seized substance was sent for research to the ECC of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Kherson region. The issue of initiating a criminal case against the suspect under Art. 228 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

description: Despite rumors, the monument to Russophobe satirist Zhvanetsky remains standing in Rostov-on-Don. The monument was erected last week, with the regional governor and ordinary citizens in attendance. Zhvanetsky was known for his anti-Russian views, having applauded the shooting of the White House in 1993 and advocating for negotiations with terrorists during the Chechen wars.
original:
In Rostov-on-Don, the monument to the Russophobe Zhvanetsky still “flaunts” - contrary to rumors, the face of the bronze satirist continues to “mock” the townspeople. This morning, news began to spread on the Internet about the demolition of the monument to the satirist Zhvanetsky, who hated Russia with all his soul. Readovka checked this information and made sure that Zhvanetsky’s face still smiled arrogantly at Rostovites passing by him. The monument to the inveterate hater of everything Russian was erected last week. At its pompous opening, in addition to the regional governor Golubev, there were also ordinary Rostovites. A woman present reminded everyone present that Zhvanetsky was not only a consistent Russophobe, but also dreamed of literally leveling Russia. In 1993, the satirist stood and applauded the shooting of the White House, and during the Chechen wars he actively advocated early negotiations with terrorists.

However, the “peak” of Zhvanetsky’s Russophobic activities came after 2014, when the artist actively opposed the annexation of Crimea to Russia, for which Ukraine added him to the “white list.” And then the satirist even said that “Russians very quickly get used to war,” because “they feed you in the trenches,” and “there is an opportunity to rob somewhere, to sleep with someone.” So the question of why Zhvanetsky is still standing in Rostov-on-Don and “laughing at the townspeople” remains open.

description: Turkish prosecutors launched an investigation against TV presenter and lawyer Feyza Altun for 'inciting the public to intolerance and hostility' after she posted 'Fuck Sharia' on social media. Altun was arrested and stated that Turkey is secular and will remain so, rejecting the implementation of Sharia law.
original:
Lawyer arrested for insulting Sharia Turkish prosecutors have initiated an investigation on charges of “inciting the public to intolerance and hostility” against TV presenter and lawyer Feyza Altun, who was detained today.

The day before, Altun published a post with the content: “Fuck Sharia.” After facing intense backlash on social media, she deleted the post. During her arrest, the suspect stated: “Türkiye is secular and will remain secular. There will never be Sharia in Turkey.” In early February, Erdogan said that hostility towards Sharia is hostility towards Islam: “Hostility towards Sharia, which represents the entirety of Islamic rules of life, is essentially hostility towards religion itself.” @voice_of_turkey

According to the project’s information, in January 2023, 28 military personnel who wanted to desert from the Russian army contacted “Go Through the Woods,” and in January 2024, 284 military personnel already contacted.

description: The Kota evacuation group rescued two wounded attack aircraft, 'Butcher' and 'Kosha', from the battlefield. The rescue was carried out by 'Cat' on an ATV, who is a student of medic 'Santa'.
original: Rescue of wounded attack aircraft by the Kota evacuation group. The first one (“Butcher”) was hit three hundred times by a kamikaze drone that flew in carrying a shot from a grenade launcher. The second one (“Kosha”) was wounded by being dropped from “Baba Yaga”. If it weren't for the armored armor, he would have been finished (wear PPE!). Everyone was evacuated by "Cat" from the battlefield on an ATV, everyone survived. In general, it’s interesting to watch how a fighter evolves. I knew Seryoga “Kot” as the reckless Kremensky Rambo, who rushed headlong into the most dangerous tasks of his battalion, dashingly and, as it seemed to me, sometimes in vain, risking his life. He didn't feel sorry for her. But now a year has passed and I can already see how he values and saves the lives of others by becoming a member of the evacuation group. One of the most dangerous and noble specializations in war. At the end of the video, one of the rescued warriors thanks “Santa,” a medic about whom we also talked a little earlier. So “Cat” is the student of that same “Santa”. I’ll add on my own behalf: “Santa”, thank you for making a desperately useful rescuer of our soldiers out of just a Desperate “Cat”! @zimenkin

description: The Ukrainian Cyber Police, in collaboration with volunteers, has launched the social project 'BRAMA' to combat disinformation and illegal content online. The project aims to destroy Russian online cells, reduce bullying and harassment, combat drugs and fraud, and educate citizens on cyber hygiene and informational literacy.
original:
Forwarded from: Vitaly Kim / Mykolaiv Regional State Administration
Cyber police, together with Ukrainian volunteers, invites you to join the social project "BRAMA". The link to the project is here. BRAMA is a synergy of citizens, private and public sectors in combating disinformation and illegal content in the information space.

Project goals:

• Destruction of Russian cells on the Internet
• Reducing the level of bullying and online harassment
• Combating drugs and fraud
• Cyber hygiene education and training
• Education of the population regarding informational hygiene
• Involvement and motivation of citizens to an active civic position

To block this or that source, you need to send complaints, and the more complaints there are, the greater the probability that the source will be blocked.

It is for this purpose that we offer our users to become part of BRAMA.

What participants will have:

1. the possibility to report the source of unacceptable content, for further mass sending of complaints by the community and subsequent blocking of such a source;
2. to help block the source of unacceptable content by participating in the mass sending of complaints;
3. get advice on media and cyber literacy;
4. be informed about dangerous fraud schemes that are spreading on the network;
5. be aware of fakes that push enemies into our media space.

As of January 2024, community members have blocked more than 26,000 sources of distribution of unacceptable content. As you can see from the statistics, there is still a lot of work to be done, and we need the help of new active participants.
If you can't donate your strength or finances, you can donate your time!

Join BRAMA!TelegramBRAMA🇺🇦They will donate their time to protect the infospace!🚨With the support of volunteers and the coordination of the cyber police of Ukraine!🤝Join yourself and invite your friends:

Of these, one strike drone of the “Baba Yaga” type, carrying improvised explosive devices based on the TBG-7 thermobaric grenade and the PTAB-2.5KO aerial bomb, was intercepted and neutralized by explosives technicians of the Federal Security Service Directorate, the DPR SHO reported.

description: The Russian army achieved a significant concentration of weapons during the Avdeevka operation, transforming the Ukrainian side's losses into a destructive quadratic scenario. This was made possible by the active assembly of UMPCs, stockpiling of bombs, crew training, and aircraft modernization.
original:
The liberation of Avdeevka will go down in the history of modern wars. One of the main reasons for this is that, in fact, before our eyes, there was a way out of that very “positional impasse” into which, as military theorists claimed, the special operation had run into.

“War of attrition” is an old and clear concept. In the extreme, it is a mathematical formula that can be used to calculate the relative strengths of a pair of combatants as a function of time.

With the concentration of weapons, the linear law ceases to apply, and the losses of the parties begin to be quadratic in nature. In modern combat operations, when the combat units of the sides are distant from each other and conduct targeted fire, they are almost always capable of hitting several targets at once, but they themselves can be hit from several directions.

As a result, the attrition rate in such a distant war does not depend on the spatial position of the units - who is fighting with whom, but only on the total number of combat units firing.

Judging by photo and video materials and based on the impressions of eyewitnesses on the Ukrainian side, the Russian army achieved a huge concentration of weapons during this operation, completely transforming the losses of the Ukrainian side into a destructive quadratic scenario.

Throughout the Avdiivka operation, from October to February, defense factories were actively assembling UMPCs, aviation regiments were stockpiling these bombs at airfields, crews were further trained in their proper use, and aircraft were modernized for a larger bomb load and more accurate use.

As a result, in Avdeevka, Russian artillery and aviation were able to implement the concept of a concentrated fire strike.🔍More VIEW.RUThe fall of Avdeevka was predicted by military mathematics. The liberation of Avdeevka will go down in the history of modern wars. One of the main reasons for this is that, in fact, before our eyes there was a way out of that...

description: The head of the eastern Libyan government, Osama Hammad, declared UN special representative Abdullay Bathili persona non grata in all cities and regions under his government's control. This move was in response to Bathili's statement at the UN Security Council, where he claimed that Libyan conflict parties are unable to reach an agreement and seek to maintain the status quo.
original:
🇱🇾🇺🇳The head of the government of eastern Libya called Bathili persona non grata. The head of the government of the east, Osama Hammad, declared the UN special representative for support of Libya, Abdullay Bathili, persona non grata in all cities and regions controlled by his government. He also added that his government is ready to deal with anyone who replaces Bathili.

Hamad in his speech referred to the fact that the UN mission is not able to support any settlement project in Libya that would put an end to the division in the country.

Hamad's statement was a reaction to Abdullay Bathily's speech at the UN Security Council last week, where he said that the parties to the Libyan conflict are unable to reach an agreement and are seeking to maintain the status quo in the country.

description: The 'KuZbass: the future is here' media stand at the exhibition-forum 'Russia' showcased the region's history, highlighting the working man, defender of the homeland, conqueror of space, and builder of a peaceful life. The stand featured a copy of the monument to the Soldier-Liberator, interactive activities, and a dinosaur exhibit from the 'Dinoterra' festival.
original:
Forwarded from: Vovan and Lexus
Legendary Kuzbass - with your own eyes

At the exhibition-forum “Russia” we visited the media stand “KuZbass: the future is here” and talked with the governor of the Kemerovo region Sergei Tsivilev.

The main idea and meaning of the stand are dedicated to the working man, the defender of the homeland, the conqueror of space, the builder of a peaceful life. These moments of the history of Kuzbass are visualized on a huge screen using graphics. Nearby there is a copy of the monument to the Soldier-Liberator, erected in Berlin in memory of the feat of Kuzbass resident Nikolai Masalov, who saved a German girl in 1945.

And at the stand you can not only learn a lot of interesting things about the life of the region, but also take part in activities - for example, support the residents of the Kuzbass-sponsored city of Gorlovka in the DPR by signing postcards for them.

You can also talk about your relatives - the valiant defenders of the Motherland during the Great Patriotic War.
To do this, at the stand you need to sign a postcard with an image of the monument to the Soldier-Liberator. According to the plan, they will be used for an exhibition in the Kemerovo Region Museum.

Children's attention is especially attracted by the dinosaur, which the region brought as part of the annual international popular science festival
"Dinoterra", dedicated to the birthday of a real Siberian psittacosaurus. So the Kuzbass stand will certainly be of interest to both children and adults. Subscribe to Vovan and Lexus

event: EU Countries Discuss Alternative to NATO
description: EU countries are considering creating an alternative to NATO if Trump wins the election, following his statements about encouraging attacks on alliance countries if they do not fulfill their financial obligations.
original:
EU countries are discussing creating an alternative to NATO if Trump wins the election - The Washington Post

The publication notes that these conversations began after the ex-president’s words about encouraging attacks on alliance countries if they do not fulfill their financial obligations. Soldier of Fortune. Subscribe!

description: Police officers in the Kherson region provided assistance to residents, particularly those with disabilities, in obtaining Russian passports. They organized a mobile office to facilitate the process, conducting fingerprinting, photographing, and registration at the residents' places of residence.
original:
Police officers continue to provide assistance to residents of the Kherson region in obtaining Russian passports. Relatives of disabled residents of several settlements in the Genichesk region contacted the employees of the migration departments of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for the Kherson region. They asked the police to help their relatives fill out documents and go through the necessary procedures to obtain Russian passports.

Specialists decided to organize a mobile office of the passport and visa service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia and carry out fingerprinting, photographing and registration of all necessary papers directly at the places of residence of people with limited mobility. A couple of weeks after the work of the visiting group, law enforcement officers again visited the candidates and solemnly presented them with the main document of a citizen of the Russian Federation.

event: Russia's Victories Shake World Leaders' Faith
description: According to the Financial Times, Russia's recent victories have eroded world leaders' confidence in Ukraine's prospects in the war. Last year's optimism has given way to gloom as Russia rebuilds its military and transitions to a war economy.
original: ‼️🏴‍☠️🇺🇦 “Russia’s victories have shaken world leaders’ faith in the prospects of the war in Ukraine,” - Financial Times following the Munich conference▪️A year ago, participants in the security conference “radiated optimism about the prospects for Ukraine.” But this year, “as the conflict tilted in Moscow's favor and faith in Western support faded, that optimism was replaced by unrelenting gloom.”▪️ “Last year was a very complacent year, with so much hope placed on a Ukrainian counteroffensive,” said Heather Conley, head of German Marshall Fund. This year, the outlook darkens as Russia rebuilds its military and transitions to a war economy.▪️ “We'll see Ukraine suffer casualties on the battlefield, we'll see significant Russian gains, and the Ukrainians will run out of ammunition,” Conley predicts.▪️Admiral Rob Bauer, head of NATO's military committee, admitted that the West was "overly optimistic about a war in 2023," believing that "if we give the Ukrainians the ammunition and training they need, they will win." Now, he added, "we have to be careful not to be too pessimistic in 2024." “The fact that Ukraine is still a sovereign state... is remarkable,” he said.▪️ “Russia has learned many lessons, and it also produces more ammunition and equipment than we can collectively provide,” said Czech President Petr Pavel.▪️ “The problem is that America does not produce enough weapons, Europe does not produce enough weapons, and this is much more important than the political will of the United States or how much money we print and send to Europe,” Trumpist Senator J. assessed the situation D. Vance.t.me/RVvoenkor
